column4: has anybody run into an installation issue where the HDD does not register when trying to boot from the disk?
when you are in the live CD run: dmesg | less     and read
Thanks will check that out
I finally got into live and ran dmesg | less
cool, what does it say about the PATA / SATA controller
looking it is a big list lol
I also burned an alternate install just incase it is a raid issue
yes, its your system loading. read what it says
you may also want to run: sudo fdisk -l    to see what partitions can be seen
yes it was not coming up with anything last night with the i386 version
ok do the controllers get detected and are the drives seen in the dmesg output
I found one it says ata1: SATA Link up 3.0 Gbps (SStatus 123 Scontrol 300)
ok does it give it a disk name like sda
no it is giving an error ata1.00: failed to IDENTIFY (I/O error, err_mask=0x4)
there is your issue, websearch for that to see what it means
your drive may need boot options or it may be failing, the websearch will show you. You could also default the BIOS to failsafe options
the drive is currently 100% NTFS with XP on it that boots fine
the websearch will show you whats going on
found some info need to research
have fun fellah
not likely it says it may be a bridge chipset problem I need to research the mobo specs and see if that is the problem
